instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data: For pre-painted galvanized surfaces: Sand lightly then wipe the surface with a clean rag before applying paint. Remove all loose paint film to sound surface. Spot prime bare substrate. For corroded galvanized surfaces: Remove rust by wire brushing and use BOYSEN®® Metal Etching Solution B‑71. Let it stay for 10-15 minutes before washing with water. Be sure to remove all remaining residue and dry completely. Solvent wipe then prime immediately.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Primer for bare substrate: BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer Red Oxide B‑2277 or BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer Gray B‑2230 Topcoat: BOYSEN®® Automotive Lacquer (in required number of coats)

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: Check paint compatibility of the existing paint film to the desired new paint. For thinning solvent, use only BOYSEN®® Epoxy Reducer B‑55 for primer and BOYSEN®® Lacquer Thinner B‑50 for topcoat. Immediately apply primer after surface preparation to avoid occurrence of flash rusting. Application of topcoat should be done within 7 days after priming to ensure good intercoat adhesion, otherwise re-application of primer is needed. If necessary, add approximately 10% by volume of BOYSEN®® Lacquer Flo B‑1205 to the ready-to-use topcoat mixture.
